solution.text:
We know, cosA=\(base\over hypotenuse\)
cosA=\(_{{4*j}}_\over_{{5*j}}_\) (given)
So, let the base(AB)=_{{4*j}}_t and hypotenuse(CA)=_{{5*j}}_t
Now, by using Pythagoras theorem we have
\((_{{5*j}}_t)^2-(_{{4*j}}_t)^2=(BC)^2\)
\(BC=_{{3*j}}_t\)
We know, sinA=\(perpendicualar\over hypotenuse\)
sinA=\(_{{3*j}}_\over _{{5*j}}_\)
similarly, tanA=\(perpendicualar\over base\)
tanA=\(_{{3*j}}_\over _{{4*j}}_\)
\(tanA+sinA\)=\(_{{3*j}}_\over _{{4*j}}_\)+\(_{{3*j}}_\over _{{5*j}}_\)
\(tanA+sinA=\frac {27}{20}\)
